entry.title: [GRA][Managed Private Registry] - End of life of registries in Harbor version 1.10
entry.content:
Aug 1, 12:23 UTC
Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed.

Aug 1, 12:00 UTC
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Aug 1, 09:07 UTC
Scheduled - Start time : 01/08/2023 12:00 UTC
End time : 01/08/2023 16:00 UTC
Service impact : All registries in version 1.10 will be shutdown during the maintenance and won't be available from 01/08/2023.
Service improvement : As precised in mail communication campaign sent on May and June, all registries in Harbor version 1.10 will be cut on 01/08.
If you didn't migrated to version 2 yet, please contact our support.

entry.title: [GRA1][Storage] - Block Storage hosts down and read-only data
entry.content:
Jul 29, 10:32 UTC
Resolved - Start time : 28/07/2023 17:20 UTC
End Time : 29/07/2023 10:30 UTC
Root cause : Hardware issue
Our technical teams resolved the issue. All impacted services are now operational.

Jul 28, 19:06 UTC
Monitoring - The issue has been identified.
A fix has been implemented. All data is now available.
However, you may experience slower than normal performance as the underlying cluster rebalances.
We are monitoring the situation until all services are operational and performance is back to pre-incident levels.

Jul 28, 17:35 UTC
Investigating - Start time : 28/07/2023 17:20 UTC
Service impact : Multiple hosts are down in multiple racks and as a results to protect data integrity part of the cluster went to fail safe read-only mode
Ongoing actions : We are investigating the cause.
Our technical teams are working on the issue. Update will be posted as significant progress is made.

entry.title: [GRA1/BHS1][Compute] - End of Sales - Catalog v1
entry.content:
Jul 26, 11:55 UTC
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Jul 26, 11:54 UTC
Scheduled - End time : 01/09/2023 00:00 UTC
Service impact : no longer be able to start new instances of types : HG / EG / SP (dedicated resources) and VPS-SSD / S1 (sandboxes)
Service improvement : Following our continuous improvement policy the catalog v1 of public cloud go to EoS. Impacted types will be removed from the catalogue.
Workaround : Here is how the old and new ranges match up:
EGs are being replaced by B2
HGs are being replaced by C2
SPs are being replaced by R2
VPS-SSD and S1 are being replaced by D2


We regularly update our solutions, and our current instance catalogue offers you better performance at competitive prices. We advise that you migrate your applications hosted on the above instances to other solutions in the current range.
However, please note that instances built on these ranges and currently running will not be shut down.
All variations of these ranges are affected, regardless of their size and operation, including their SSD variants.
Instances of these ranges that have already been booted can be kept for now. You can always rebuild one of these instances if needed.
However, we recommend planning to migrate to a newer instance range.
Please view our catalogue for more information.
Generally, the new ranges run on newer hardware and benefit from improvements such increased cache capacity and more bus bandwidth.
What’s more, all instances now work with a local root disk on the hypervisor. Unlike some instances from the previous range, the EG, SP and HG models do not have the “-SSD” suffix.
You can still launch an instance on a remote disk.

It will be possible to resize instances based on the old range by targeting an instance type from the current range. However, there is a technical constraint that will force you to select a more powerful machine most of the time. The disk size must be equal to or greater than the target instance. For example, an EG-15 instance (400 GB of disk) can be migrated to a B2-60 (also 400 GB of disk), while an EG-15-SSD (200 GB of disk) can be migrated to a B2-30 (also 200 GB of disk).
Instances with large disks that don’t have an equivalent in the current range (the EG-120, HG-120 and SP-240 models) will need to be migrated manually, via a reinstallation or an optimisation of the system image.

Thank you for choosing OVHcloud.
The OVHcloud Team

entry.title: [Global][PublicCloud] - Images EoL
entry.content:
Jul 19, 00:14 UTC
Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed.

Jun 26, 12:51 UTC
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Jun 26, 12:50 UTC
Scheduled - End time : 19/07/2023 00:00 UTC
Service impact : Below-mentioned images will no longer be available to purchase or use.

Several images that we are currently offering for Public Cloud and VPS are going to reach or has already reached End of Life (EoL).
On July 19th, 2023, we will proceed to End of Life these images from Public Cloud and VPS offerings.
You can read furthermore about our distribution End Of Life policy here: https://help.ovhcloud.com/csm/en-gb-public-cloud-compute-vps-image-life-cycle?id=kb_article_view&sysparm_article=KB0050801

Below is the complete list of images, as well our recommendations and alternatives for Public Cloud and VPS environments.
EoL Distribution EoL / EoS date Alternative Distribution Recommended action
Debian 9 2022-07-01 Debian 10 or 11 Backup and upgrade distribution
Fedora 34 2022-06-07 Fedora 37 or 38 Backup and upgrade distribution
Fedora 35 2022-12-13 Fedora 37 or 38 Backup and upgrade distribution
Fedora 36 2023-05-16 Fedora 37 or 38 Backup and upgrade distribution
Ubuntu 18.04 2023-06-01 Ubuntu 20.04, 22.04 or 23.04 Backup and upgrade distribution
Ubuntu 21.10 2022-07-14 Ubuntu 20.04, 22.04 or 23.04 Backup and upgrade distribution
Ubuntu 22.10 2023-07-01 Ubuntu 20.04, 22.04 or 23.04 Backup and upgrade distribution

Starting from July 19th, 2023, you will no longer be able to purchase or reinstall services with the above-mentioned images.
If you use automation to deploy your infrastructure with any of these images, we strongly recommend you to either change them to another distribution or upload your own image and use it instead.

You can refer to the following guides to:
Upgrade operating system: https://help.ovhcloud.com/csm/en-gb-public-cloud-compute-upgrade-operating-system?id=kb_article_view&sysparm_article=KB0051306
Upload your image: https://help.ovhcloud.com/csm/en-gb-public-cloud-compute-upload-own-image?id=kb_article_view&sysparm_article=KB0051319

For any question, please reach out to our support team.
